name: Bats by Marijpol: small
description: Hand cut paper bat faces. Super great.

name: Bats by Marijpol: medium
description: hand cut paper bat faces. Awesome.

name: Bats by Marijpol: Large
description: hand cut paper bat faces. LARGE

name: Big Questions back issues
description: old issues of Big Questions comics. I have issues #5 and #6 which are $20 and issues 8-11 and 13-15 which are all $10. (if you want #5 or #6 just click on here twice and put it in the notes. Also in the notes: tell me which issue you want. I'm too lazy right now to make ten different listings.

name: you were born and so you're free
description: two-color screenprint comic printed on old topographical map. It's about life and death and transformation and the history of the universe from beginning to end. A second version appears in the book The End.

name: Monologuist paper update #1
description: weird found paper sketchbook mini comic with a bunch of postcards and a sticker.

name: Some Breath King
description:
This is a three-color, screen-printed accordion book in an edition of 100, made as part of PFC4, an international artist residency held in Minneapolis at MCAD in August 2013. It was printed by Aesthetic Apparatus and hand made by the artists. Each page is a collaboration between two of the 20 artists who took part in the residency, hailing from the U.S., Canada, France and Belgium. Each artist chose a character from a list (compiled by myself and Zak Sally) and then were paired randomly (with an emphasis on combining English and French speakers) and tasked with creating a one-page interaction between their characters.
      The pairings were, in order: Marc Bell and Domitille Collardey, Lilli Carre and Emilie Plateau, Tom Kaczynski and Jean-Christophe Menu, Sandrine Martin and Kevin Huizenga, Lisa Hanawalt and Pierre Ferrero, Eugene Riousse and Jim Rugg, John Porcellino and Benoit Preteseille, Eleanor Davis and Max de Radigues, Genevieve Castree and David Libens and Zak Sally and myself.
      With each order I'll throw in a few of the test print postcards (pictured) from the printing process as well, which feature fragments from the book combined with fragments from recent prints by Aesthetic. All proceeds go to support PFC and ChiFouMi.

name: monologuist paper update supplemental #3
description: The inside is a four color screenprint, approximating CMYK (printed by Burlesque), of some collage comics I did originally for a Post-It show at Giant Robot in LA a few years ago. On the outside is a five color print I did myself based on some sketchbook drawings. Every piece is slightly different in terms of color and placement. It's a signed and numbered 'edition' of 70. 8.5" x 24", folded in thirds. It comes with a similarly monoprint-ish test print combining the imagery from the inside and out. Individual results may vary.

name: Autoptic Poster
description: This is the poster I designed for AUTOPTIC, the independent comics and graphics festival I'm helping organize, which is coming up in a week or so (depending on when you read this). It was printed with four colors (not quite CMYK - my own private recipe) by Burlesque here in Minneapolis. And they knocked it out of the park. The colors are sharp and gorgeous. It really pops. It's a signed and numbered edition of 100. We'll be selling it at the show as well, and maybe at the Autoptic site, but as I write this it's only available here. 24" x 35.5"

name: Holiday Price List
description: Last December I did a series of small collage drawings for Post-It 7 at Giant Robot in L.A. that, taken together made up a sort of holiday catalog. I didn't finish it in time to make a book of it last year, but am rectifying the situation this year. Place your order in time to place your order. 20 pages, full color, 5.5" x 5.67".

name: Monologuist Paper Supplement #2: The Hole and Colombia
description: I put together a mini for the Brooklyn Comics and Graphics Festival in November. It collects an eight page story from my sketchbook along with a few sketchbook drawings and comics from my recent trip to Colombia. 12 pages, fold out cover, 7.125" x 6.75". Color.

name: Big Questions Trading Cards
description: I made these as a sort of promotional give-away kind of thing. I sent small stacks to stores that ordered The Game, and put cards in orders from here. I sent a bunch to Drawn and Quarterly to do with as they saw fit as well. I also made a few full sets to sell on the road for gas money. I'm going to make one last batch a little later this month. I'm taking orders starting now so I know how many to make (they're a little labor intensive to print, cut and wrap). There are 24 individual cards, representing a few more characters than are on the flaps of the book. the paper stock is the thickest, chunkiest, acid-free art paper I can jam through my friend's high-res, six-color, archival ink printer. Action shots on the back. Sorry â€“ no chewing gum. These won't ship until around November 25th. But that gives you all kinds of time before Christmas, kids.

name: Big Questions outakes and process zine
description:
For the signing I did in Brooklyn at Desert Island Gabe asked me to put together a small zine or print to have as a giveaway with the book. I told him he was crazy, I had no time and wasn't a six hundred page graphic novel and 30 city book tour enough. Geez. And then about a week before I left I got inspired and decided he was right, what a good idea. Wasn't he surprised when, with no time to spare I sent him a 24 page zine of outtakes, process pages and various other related material that wasn't published anywhere else. And I demanded that he print the cover in color. And he actually got it done. Bless that man. This is the result. 
      Included are images of some matchbooks I made to go with issue #3 and the strip I did during a workshop at the DH Lawrence ranch in 1996 that includes the first appearance of the birds anywhere ever and the germ of the story that would eventually turn into BQ. And a bunch of other stuff. 24 pages, on newsprint, 7" x 8.5".

name: The Game poster/mini
description:
This is the fully painted 'angels with machine guns' strip I did for the giant-sized Kramer's Ergot #7 in 2008. The strip in Kramer's was 3 pages. This poster/mini includes the previously unpublished fourth page. Each page is 19.5" x 16". Offset printed.

for the first week of orders I'm offering it for $9 postage paid.

name: Meteorite Print
description: I did a series of drawings of these round amalgamated stone like hunks of indeterminate matter a couple of years ago in sketchbooks and then did three larger versions for a show at Home Gallery in Chicago in 2009. This is the largest, printed actual size for a show at Littlebird in L.A. opening December 9th. I'll put these up for sale here the following day. Signed and numbered archival pigment print. Edition of 25. 10" x 13".
